This analysis should be conducted using **MEGA**.

The steps to open the data in MEGA are explained under **Alignment.**

Let's start by clicking on "Models," followed by "Find Best DNA/Protein Models (ML)...

![](nj.jpg){fig-align="center"}

This action will open a new window where you can set parameters based on your input data and researcher preferences. After clicking "Ok," a table similar to the following will be generated.

![](nj2.png){fig-align="center"}

This table indicates the optimal model for constructing the tree.

Now that we have identified the best model, let's close this table and proceed to `Phylogeny`, then select `Construct/Test Neighbor-Joining Tree`

![](nj3.png)

Then another window will open where you can select the ideal model we just tested. After clicking `Ok`, the tree will be generated.

![](nj4.png){fig-align="center" width="443"}

![](NJ5.png)
